channel.title: Congratulations on releasing Black Mesa
channel.description:
Dear Black Mesa Dev team
I have been following your work since the beginning. When I first saw the trailer back in 2008 I was amazed at the work you've done and couldn't wait for 2009 but after hearing it needed more work i was sad to hear about it. so I all waited till you released part of the game and I was amazed at all the small details you've added to it. This was a true homage to the original half-life game. I cant wait to see what else you guys do in the future. So congratulation on soon releasing Black Mesa on Steam.
Thank you guys for your dedicated work on your game

item.title: Congratulations on releasing Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
To say we lied is to say all along we knew one thing, and yet stated another. The fact of the matter is that yes at one point we did say never ever pay, however along the way it changed. We DID let the fanbase know but the fact that we didnt broadcast it every month to ensure every last fan got the message is where there is a problem but I can’t see how that is our fault. At this stage all we can do is offer patience while folks realize there was a change of plans. In the meantime, the mod version is free so feel free consider it a gift for the inconvenience. That is 7 years worth of work by at least 100 dev members to you without any charge.

Also, for the record, people change their mind all the time. Would you honestly expect someone to say one thing 5 years ago and say “welp, I said X 5 years ago, therefore I cannot possibly change my mind or opinion” ?

Actually, even if I keep 11°C it wouldn’t be enough to afford a game. At any rate, I don’t want to be pitied, not to whine about the price. I already said what I had to, but don’t make fun of me because I wasn’t expecting a price tag and I didn’t follow BMS all my free time.

I’m not “making fun” of you. You didn’t expect a price tag? Okay, sure, but accusing the devs of lying (when they’ve done no such thing) and encouraging piracy of the game they’ve spent over ten years of their lives working on is completely uncalled for.

Like I said, there’s a difference between not being able to afford it due to actual financial problems and refusing to pay for it because “it costs money” - Like it or not, your posts up until now sound completely like someone in the second category.

item.title: Congratulations on releasing Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: idclip
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:
idclip:
bkdale86:

You will never be charged to play the mod it’s still free.

So what does the purchasable version have more than the mod? Is it only a way to fund the developers? Why not donations instead?Also thank for answering and uhhh so many fanboys attacking. You don’t do a great service to these people you know? Only show that the fans are [insert negative adjectives here]. :l

Some of us wish to work on this game full time to get it up to the quality and standard it deserves. A donation model is not sustainable in the slightest, this has been proven time and time again. The reason any of this has taken so long is because everyone works on a volunteer basis, and has a real life and jobs and well…are human. Not only did going retail give us engine level access; something which isn’t possible without a license, it also allows us to commit more resources to further improving the game to the quality we all want.
This post details just some of the things the retail has which the mod does not. It is substantial, and that list isn’t even close to exhaustive. People who are saying this is the same as the free release 2 years ago are flat out completely wrong.

Thanks for the answer.

Also you may want to check page 2 where you can find more insults by Dark-Storm.

@KyuuGryphon: If I want to buy a 20€ game I’ve to save up for 2 months, or to keep 11°C at home rather than 16° during the winter season. Actually, even if I keep 11°C it wouldn’t be enough to afford a game. At any rate, I don’t want to be pitied, not to whine about the price. I already said what I had to, but don’t make fun of me because I wasn’t expecting a price tag and I didn’t follow BMS all my free time.

item.title: Congratulations on releasing Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Black Mesa is now a product, not a gift of good will. It was originally released for free because they couldn’t sell a mod based on an intellectual property without buying a license from Valve to do so first. The devs didn’t lie, originally it was meant to be just a mod so for free, but if they wanted to get it on Steam and improve the overall quality of it, it needed to become a commercial game. If it hadn’t become a commercial game, it would have stayed a free mod, but the quality and options would be so much lower now.

So essentially you are calling the devs names for having done a better job.
